sentence.Network_en: Some days I feel like Sisyphus. Remember him?
sentence.Network_cn: 有些时候,我觉得自己似乎成了西西弗斯, 还记得这个人物 吗 ?

sentence.Network_en: SISYPHUS was lucky. He could have wound up on the Basel committee.
sentence.Network_cn: Sisyphus(西西佛思)是幸运的. 他本来可能会沦落到巴塞尔委员会.

sentence.Network_en: At any rate , Sisyphus was given an exemplary punishment.
sentence.Network_cn: 总之, 西绪福斯受到了起杀一儆百作用的惩罚.

means.word_mean: 1. (Greek legend) a king in ancient Greece who offended Zeus and whose punishment was to roll a huge boulder to the top of a steep hill; each time the boulder neared the top it rolled back down and Sisyphus was forced to start again
